abstract.p: Three Swedish companies, Ericsson, Investor AB and AB Industrivarden, and Merrill Lynch will form a $300 million venture capital fund to invest in mobile Internet start-up firms (S)

block.p: Three Swedish companies, Ericsson, Investor A.B. and A.B. Industrivarden, along with Merrill Lynch, said they would form a $300 million venture capital fund to invest in mobile Internet start-up firms. The fund will be called Ericsson Venture Partners and will focus on all aspects of mobile Internet technology, including network infrastructure, services and applications. In June, Ericsson, the Stockholm-based telecommunications company, said it would start an incubator and venture-capital company called INN to develop technologies beyond its core telecommunications-equipment business. Industrivarden is one of Sweden's largest holding companies with a portfolio worth about $8 billion. Investor, whose largest shareholder is the Wallenberg family of Sweden, manages about $20 billion in assets.
